title: Urgent Account Verification Required
description:
From: security@yourbank-support.com
Subject: Urgent: Verify Your Account Information

Dear Customer,

We detected unusual activity on your account. Please click the link below immediately to verify your identity and prevent account suspension:

http://yourbank-support-login.co/verify

Failure to do so within 24 hours will result in permanent account closure.

Sincerely,
Your Bank Security Team

options.text: Click the link to verify identity.
Ignore the email and delete it.
Reply with your account details.
Call the bank using the number on their official website.

feedbackCorrect: Correct! Verifying through official channels or deleting suspicious emails is safe.
feedbackIncorrect: Incorrect. Clicking suspicious links or replying can compromise your account.
linkHoverText: The link points to 'yourbank-support-login.co', not the official bank domain.

detailedFeedback.0: Incorrect. Clicking links in suspicious emails is dangerous. The sender address ('yourbank-support.com') and link domain ('yourbank-support-login.co') look unofficial and are designed to steal your login details.
detailedFeedback.1: Correct. Ignoring and deleting suspicious emails is a safe way to handle potential phishing attempts without interacting with them.
detailedFeedback.2: Incorrect. Never reply to suspicious emails with personal or account information. Legitimate institutions won't ask for sensitive data via email.
detailedFeedback.3: Correct. Contacting the bank directly using a known, trusted phone number (from their official site or back of your card) is the safest way to verify any account issues.

title: Fertilizer Subsidy Application
description:
From: agri-subsidies@gov-schemes.in
Subject: Claim Your Fertilizer Subsidy Now!

Dear Farmer,

You are eligible for the new government fertilizer subsidy! To apply, please download the attached application form (Subsidy_Form.pdf), fill it out, and email it back along with a scanned copy of your Aadhaar card.

Apply quickly, limited funds available!

Regards,
Dept. of Agriculture Subsidy Portal

options.text: Download and open the PDF immediately.
Forward the email to other farmers.
Delete the email as it looks suspicious.
Visit the official Dept. of Agriculture website to check for this scheme.

feedbackCorrect: Well done! Verifying on official websites or deleting suspicious emails is the way to go.
feedbackIncorrect: Risky! Unsolicited attachments can contain malware.

detailedFeedback.0: Risky! Opening attachments from unknown or suspicious senders (like 'gov-schemes.in' which might not be official) can install malware or ransomware on your device.
detailedFeedback.1: Incorrect. Forwarding potential scams only spreads the risk to others. It's better to verify or delete.
detailedFeedback.2: Correct. If an email seems suspicious (unsolicited request for sensitive info, urgency, unofficial sender), deleting it without interaction is a safe response.
detailedFeedback.3: Correct. Always verify government schemes or requests by visiting the official government department's website directly. Don't rely on links or contact info in unsolicited emails.

title: Invoice Payment Overdue
description:
From: accounts@agri-supplies-ltd.com
Subject: OVERDUE: Invoice INV-7890 Payment Required

Dear Partner,

Our records show invoice INV-7890 for your recent seed order is overdue. Please remit payment immediately to avoid disruption.

Due to a recent system update, please use the following new bank details for this payment:
Account Name: Agri Supplies Global
Account Number: [Fake Account Number]
IFSC: [Fake IFSC]

A copy of the invoice is attached for your reference (Invoice_7890_Updated.zip).

Regards,
Accounts Payable, Agri Supplies Ltd.

options.text: Download the zip file to check the invoice.
Make the payment to the new bank details provided.
Contact your usual representative at Agri Supplies Ltd. using their known phone number to verify the change.
Reply to the email asking for confirmation.

feedbackCorrect: Excellent choice. Always verify payment changes out-of-band.
feedbackIncorrect: Be careful! This is a common scam.

detailedFeedback.0: Incorrect. ZIP files from unexpected emails are highly suspicious and often contain malware. Don't download or open them unless you've verified the sender's legitimacy through other means.
detailedFeedback.1: Incorrect. Never change payment details based solely on an email request. Business Email Compromise (BEC) scams rely on tricking people into sending money to fraudulent accounts.
detailedFeedback.2: Correct. The safest action is to contact your known supplier contact via a trusted method (phone) to confirm if the payment details have actually changed and if the invoice is legitimate.
detailedFeedback.3: Risky. Replying to the email might seem logical, but you could be communicating directly with the scammer who will falsely confirm the details. Out-of-band verification is needed.

title: Platform Security Alert
description:
From: NoReply <security@agriconnect-platform.net>
Subject: Security Alert: Unusual Login Attempt Detected

Hi [Your Name],

We detected a login attempt to your AgriConnect account from an unrecognized device in [Different City/Country].

If this was not you, please secure your account immediately by clicking here: https://agriconnect-platform-security-check.info/secure

If you authorized this login, you can ignore this message.

Thanks,
The AgriConnect Team

options.text: Click the link immediately to secure the account.
Log in to the AgriConnect platform through your usual bookmark or by typing the official URL, and check security settings there.
Ignore the email since you haven't noticed any issues.
Forward the email to the platform's support email address found on their official website.

feedbackCorrect: Good thinking! Verify independently or report suspicious emails.
feedbackIncorrect: Watch out! Fake login pages or ignoring alerts can be dangerous.
linkHoverText: The link points to 'agriconnect-platform-security-check.info', which is not the official platform domain.

detailedFeedback.0: Incorrect. The link likely leads to a fake login page designed to steal your password. Notice the suspicious domain name ('agriconnect-platform-security-check.info'). Never click links in security alerts.
detailedFeedback.1: Correct. This is the safest way. Always access sensitive accounts directly through official URLs you know or bookmarks, not through links in emails, especially security alerts.
detailedFeedback.2: Risky. While many alerts are false positives or phishing, ignoring a potential real alert could lead to account compromise if the attack was successful. Independent verification is better.
detailedFeedback.3: Correct. Forwarding suspicious emails (as attachments, if possible) to the official support address helps the platform identify and block phishing attempts.

title: Fake Technical Support Message
description:
** System Alert **

Warning: Your computer may be infected with malware!

Malicious activity detected. Your financial data might be at risk.

Call Microsoft Certified Support immediately at: 1-800-XXX-XXXX [Fake Number]

Ref Error Code: WDSC0078

options.text: Call the number provided immediately.
Restart the computer.
Close the popup/browser tab showing the message.
Run a scan with your installed, reputable antivirus software.

feedbackCorrect: Correct. Close fake alerts and rely on your own security software.
feedbackIncorrect: Incorrect. Tech support scams aim to trick you.

detailedFeedback.0: Incorrect. This is a classic tech support scam. The number connects to fraudsters, not Microsoft. They will try to gain remote access and charge you for fake fixes or install actual malware.
detailedFeedback.1: Ineffective. Restarting might temporarily remove the fake popup, but it doesn't confirm or remove any real threat (which is unlikely to exist based on this type of alert).
detailedFeedback.2: Correct. Fake alerts often appear as popups or browser tabs. Simply closing them is usually sufficient to dismiss the scam attempt.
detailedFeedback.3: Correct. If you are concerned about malware, the appropriate action is to run a full scan using your own trusted antivirus software, not to call a number shown in a random popup.

title: Marketplace Buyer Inquiry (Suspicious Link)
description:
New Message from Buyer 'AgriTrader12'

Subject: Question about your Wheat Listing

Hi, I am interested in your listing. Before I make an offer, can you confirm the quality? Please see the attached specification sheet I require: [Link to a file sharing site like filebin.net/xyzabc or similar]

Does your product meet these standards?

Thanks

options.text: Click the link to download and check the specifications.
Reply asking the buyer to describe the required specifications in the message instead of using a link.
Ignore the message as it seems suspicious.
Make an offer directly without checking the link.

feedbackCorrect: Good choices. Avoid suspicious links from unknown contacts.
feedbackIncorrect: Risky. Clicking unknown links can lead to malware.
linkHoverText: The link goes to an external file-sharing site, not the platform itself.

detailedFeedback.0: Incorrect. Links from unknown marketplace users, especially those pointing to external file-sharing sites, are very risky and frequently used to distribute malware.
detailedFeedback.1: Correct. This is a safe way to proceed. If the buyer is legitimate, they should be able to provide the required specifications directly. If they insist on the link, it increases suspicion.
detailedFeedback.2: Correct. If a message seems off (unusual request, suspicious link), ignoring it is a valid and safe security measure on marketplaces.
detailedFeedback.3: Risky. While you avoid the link, engaging further with a potentially malicious actor (by making an offer) might lead to other scam attempts later in the transaction.
